title: Mid Champs that Double for other roles?
body: I Have 4800 IP and im looking at a few champs to run mid, but i  also want them to be able to work in other lanes currently im looking at {{champion:85}} because i know he can mid (and last time i checked he worked as a top and maybe an adc too) also im looking at {{champion:63}} because he can mid and support, then theres {{champion:8}} who can mid and top. But I'm not sure how viable any of these champs are anymore, as i havent seen them in a long time, Suggestions on any? or maybe on some you may think would be better to get (I already have quite a few champs so any others that are suggested i may own)

replies.body:
Karma, mid/top/support
Kennen, mid/top
Vladimir, mid/top
Ezreal, mid/adc
Swain, mid/top
Karthus, mid/jungle
Morgana, mid/top/support
Jarvan, mid/top/jungle

Honestly, I wouldn't worry much about whether you've seen the champion in a while. No one saw Viktor ever until... well about 2 weeks ago and now everyone's playing him. I would never correlate popularity with strength if I were you.

Own all those champs besides Kennen and Vlad, i almost want to get one of them cause of the no mana usage so i feel it would make my life just a little easer, but Brand seems fun, and his ult is powerful in groups
Lux is a mid/support if you want one of those

The only problem with Brand is that he melts to most assassins, since his one CC move requires you to hit them with a spell, then skillshot with Q. If you panic when they jump on you (sometimes even if you don't panic), it can be hard to hit.

But his passive is amazing. 8% max health DoT... it just begs for {{item:3151}}
Viktor is the shiz.

Oddly i was thinking about playing Victor again the day before that. But didn't want to be part of the bandwagon T__T So i decided not to.

Play with what you feel comfortable with no one know's what you like better than you. How can I tell you that picking this champ or that champ would improve you as a player only you and you only know what needs to be done.

Not asking anyone to improve me as a player, im asking for suggestions on a Champ that does what im looking for, so i have 3 choices of what im wanting to buy currently (I will eventually getting them all) But i want to see peoples opinions on the different characters
{{champion:9}} can do any lane but adc well

{{champion:8}} is a lot of fun, definitely one of my favorites.  Makes for a pretty good poke mage for mid and an incredible tank late game for top.
Kinda squishy until around level 9 and he definitely needs spell vamp.  I like getting {{item:3145}} and then getting {{item:3065}} shortly thereafter.
From there I just kinda go situational.  

{{champion:90}} If you're feeling really brave, you can build him AD and take him into the jungle.  Seen absolutely terrifying footage of him wrecking as jungler.

Lulu - support/mid/top and I heard she can be done in jungle but that might have been in last season.
Velkoz - support/mid
Gragas - mid/supp/jungle/top
Lissandra - top/mid (and I had some succses with her as support)
Azir - mid/top
Annie - mid/support (and someone tries top with her)
Galio - mid/top/support (stron against AP dealers and nonexistant egainst AD teams)

..and nobody mentioned {{champion:64}}, the [melee, tanky dps, assassin, mage, tank, support, jungler](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CXxcpaCr1hw) yet! Play him wherever, it's freelo!

In all honesty though, {{champion:85}} would probably be the best pick. Fun to play, nice counter to Zed, varied build paths and relatively stable throughout the seasons, so he'll probably still be relevant a few patches in. :)
Diana can be played mid, top, AND jungle and do all three extremely well

Post edit: halfway through list forgot you said MID champs, may have listed a few that are not common mid but honestly, if you comfortable with any champ you can take it to any role (look at one trick ponys)

{{champion:82}} : Can do Top, or Mid. (I've also seen him jungle, but I wouldn't recommend it)

{{champion:31}} : Mid, Top, Jungle, and if you have REALLY good mana management, you can even take him bot lane as a support.
Got Cho, but not Mordekaiser, he never seemed like a champ that would appeal to me, i'll wait till a free week and check him out

Morde's fun, but has a few pretty big weaknesses. Basically no mobility, or CC make him easy targets for ganks, and if he can't get his damage out he's squishy, but in the middle of a fight if he can avoid being CC'd (Either from help from a Mikael's support, Cleanse summoner spell, or just other targets for enemy CC) he can absolutely DESTROY an enemy team. And if you burst the enemy ADC with your ult your team now has two ADCs, and you're basically guaranteed to win the fight. Fun stuff.
Cho with Relic Shield has some pretty crazy self-sustain.

{{champion:74}} Can be mid or top. Not really needs to be explained for why lol.
{{champion:112}}  Can go mid or top. Heard you max Q for top first for the shield and movement, but idk. Haven't tried it yet. (Hoping that his recent play in the pros doesn't get him hurt, being my fave champ in game next to {{champion:31}} .. Either that or the band wagon people that are now going to try and pick him up...)
{{champion:161}} Can be mid, but I much rather support. High harass/peel, just watch your mana. Max Q for damage as support then I usually do E for cooldown on his knock up rather than W for clear/poke. Just find him to be much safer being a support for ADC than being solo in mid and at risk of higher mobility champs, such as {{champion:103}} or {{champion:238}} to just name probly the two more common I've seen, or jungle ganks.
{{champion:26}} Can be mid or support. I actually found his latest changes to be amazing and help him even more. Bombs being a skill shot that can latch onto enemies or allies? Makes him all the more deadlier and safe. Haven't really found any major downsides to him aside from W not working on R, but bombs being how they are more than make up for it with zoning for time. Plus the double bomb stun is beautiful.
{{champion:101}} Mid or support. Haven't tried him as support since the mana changes, but he works surprisingly decent. Just play similar to Vel and play safe behind minions/well-warded while poking. I usually go 1 point in Q at the start, but max W(can poke behind wave without risking CS loss on ADC and the slow) then E.

Viktor is both a really good mid laner and a pretty good top laner as well. He's a little expensive and fairly hard to play, but he's really fun to play once you learn him and is very worth giving a shot.

How has nobody said Diana? GO DIANA! I main mid and shes my favorite champion to play. She can also play top and jungle, and actually the entire reason I bought her was so I could learn jungle. Her q & ult combo is really unique and gives her incredible gank potential. Most of her counters in the mid lane are rarely played and you wont see much of them, while she counters some of the mainstream meta mid picks like Katarina, Zed, Akali. She also holds up great in the jungle, her shield gives her amazing sustain. She is a complete utility knife and mastering her can make you a master of the mid lane, top and the jungle.

Got her already :P, back when she was released i used her Jungle, then whatever they did to her kit i attempted her again and did pretty bad so i kind of dropped her, guess i just never gave her another good try.
Definitely try her again in the jungle. The new changes to her shield rotating faster gives her surprisingly good sustain compared to other junglers as it almost always stays up while clearing.

1. Karma {{champion:43}}.
Back in season 4, she could mid, support, Top AND jungle. But alas, the mana changes and changes to the jungle have relegated her to top, mid and support only.
annie{{champion:1}}
There's absolutely nothing wrong with Kennen or Swain. Both work for mid and top, and Kennen can in fact go ADC, though it's a little different than most.
I would say Morgana and Zyra are two of your best bets (I know Zyra is 6300), but both are great in the mid or support position.

Own Morgana, and I was considereing getting Zyra instead of Velkoz (Back when i had 6300) but I went with Vel cause he seemed to be more of a "Carry" Support, someone i could build damage but still have the Utility as a support

Vel'Koz is a great carry/support, but Zyra has a ton of zoning and peeling potential and her ult is great for disengaging/wombo comboing. She's more utility than straight damage. Vel's utility is nearly nonexistent (no hard CC/escape moves other than his E, which can be hard to land).
Since nobody mentioned it Cassiopeia mid/top.
Orianna, mid/support
Already got her as well ^.^

Vel'koz works almost exactly the same in support as in mid. It's comp-dependent, but he scales almost as well off levels as off items. Start Spellthief, poke with Q or W, peel with E, get Liandry's by mid-lategame, and ult intelligently. Congrats! You are now a carry support.
Already got him :)

Lissandra Mid/Top
Morgana Mid/Top/Support
Annie Mid/Top/Support
Riven Top/Mid
Yasuo Mid/Top
I own most of those besides Yasuo and Lissandra, I was considering Yasuo at one point, but my friends said he was outclassed easily by other champs, so i was gonna just get someone else before that.
Yasuo can just about go anywhere he wants. Even the jungle with the right team comp. (team with knock ups for him to ult gank into)

Kog'maw! He's a solid ADC, but also incredibly fun mid. Seraph's + Liandry's = raining hellfire artillery literally forever. Getting to level 6 can be a bit of a struggle with no escape moves and only a moderately strong high cooldown slow, but once you're there, you can farm ultra safely and wreak havoc from the back line.
from jungler point of view i would say go with brand or kennen, both champs brings alot with their kits in ganks and both can hold on 1v2 or 2v2, vlad little to help secure kills in ganks

Lissandra.
